title: Swap branding logo + favicon to new Indian Fitness logo asset

requirements.summary: Add the uploaded transparent logo as a standardized 512×512 square PNG static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated/.
acceptanceCriteria: A new 512×512 PNG logo file exists in `frontend/public/assets/generated/`.
The added logo has a transparent background (not a black/gray rectangle).
The logo renders crisp at small sizes (40–48px) without obvious cropping.

file_operations.description: Add the provided transparent PNG logo as a square 512×512 PNG at this exact path/filename for consistent rendering across the app.

requirements.summary: Point BRANDING.logo.path to the new logo asset so all branding-driven logo placements (header/footer) update globally.
acceptanceCriteria: `BRANDING.logo.path` is updated to the new asset path.
The header logo (in `frontend/src/components/layout/Header.tsx`) displays the new logo on desktop and mobile.
The footer logo (in `frontend/src/components/layout/Footer.tsx`) displays the new logo.

file_operations.description: Update `BRANDING.logo.path` to `/assets/generated/logo-indian-fitness-unisex-gym.dim_512x512.png` so existing header/footer logo renders use the new asset everywhere branding config is consumed.

requirements.summary: Update the HTML favicon link to reference the new logo asset so the browser tab icon matches the updated branding.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/index.html` references the new logo asset for the favicon.
After reload, the browser tab/favicon shows the new logo (may require hard refresh depending on caching).

file_operations.description: Change the favicon `<link rel='icon'>` to reference `/assets/generated/logo-indian-fitness-unisex-gym.dim_512x512.png`.
